export const Badge = (props) => <><span class={'badge badge--' + props.class}>{props.text}</span></>


Query the network to list the transaction inputs from an address


```graphql
transactionInputs(
  address: Address!
  limit: PosInteger
  pagingOffset: NonNegInteger
): [TransactionInput]
```


### Arguments

#### [<code style={{ fontWeight: 'normal' }}>transactionInputs.<b>address</b></code>](#)<Bullet />[`Address!`](/build/api/schema/scalars/address) <Badge class="secondary" text="non-null"/> <Badge class="secondary" text="scalar"/>
> 
> 

#### [<code style={{ fontWeight: 'normal' }}>transactionInputs.<b>limit</b></code>](#)<Bullet />[`PosInteger`](/build/api/schema/scalars/pos-integer) <Badge class="secondary" text="scalar"/>
> 
> 

#### [<code style={{ fontWeight: 'normal' }}>transactionInputs.<b>pagingOffset</b></code>](#)<Bullet />[`NonNegInteger`](/build/api/schema/scalars/non-neg-integer) <Badge class="secondary" text="scalar"/>
> 
> 

### Type

#### [`TransactionInput`](/build/api/schema/objects/transaction-input) <Badge class="secondary" text="object"/>
> [TransactionInput] represents the inputs from the transaction
It includes:
- From: transaction which send the amount of assets
- Amount: asset amount
- Type: UCO/token/Call
- token address: address of the token if the type is token
- Spent: determines if the input has been spent
- Timestamp: Date time when the inputs was generated
- token id: It is the id for a token which is allocated when the token is minted.

>
